Posts.Content: I had my last chemo on 5th December and although J should be delighted it felt like a bit of an anticlimax.  But now the side-effects are started to ease (a bit) and knowing I haven't got to go through it all again in a couple of weeks I'm feeling happier. As lots of people say, it IS doable.  Drinking more  and sleeping when I need to have been the most helpful things I think. Happy Christmas to everyone!
Posts.Title: * * * December Breast Cancer Chemo Club * * *

Posts.Content: Stripeymaz As already said that sounds awful and well done for your action. There are 3 consultant oncologists in the breast team at my hospital and they are all excellent.  I saw a registrar for my second check-up during chemo and she was useless.  I felt really rushed, she didn't answer any of my questions and it felt like a waste of time. I then saw the consultant next time and she was really helpful, listened to me and as well as leaving with 2 prescriptions she offered to see me again if I was struggling (with the hot flushes mainly). Hope your next appointment is a much better experience x Ann
Posts.Title: A moan if I may !

Posts.Content: Thanks Sheryl I was told by my oncologist that I would also find out when my treatment will start.  I know if will be January but I feel everything is on hold until  I find out when exactly x Ann
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Lin, that's good to know.  I'm on week 4 post-chemo today.  Not too bad but I have had some leg stiffness but horrible heartburn (too much food and drink over Christmas didn't help!).  Back on omeprazole now. Ann
Posts.Title: Post chemo

Posts.Content: I'm not starting treatment until Jan (sorry to butt jn!) but I have got my CT planning appt on Monday and not sure what to expect.  The letter says expect to be there for 2 hours. Ann
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Oops sorry Shey - stupid auto correct x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Kim Thanks for your reply.  I saw the oncologist on 4th December so hopefully won't have to do that again.  The writing sounds interesting - be nice if they could add a Christmas message too - LOL Ann
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ December Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Wow JoDec You're doing better than me.  Finished chemo 5th Dec and then radiotherapy for 3 weeks in January.  I didn't lose all my hair but was thin and patchy.  It's growing on the sides, not so much on top and still wearing my wig for work.  I've been watering a hat when going out but now it's not so cold it looks a bit different. As far as shampoo goes I've been using my normal Tresemme  Ann
Posts.Title: Hair Loss - Question about regrowth.

Posts.Content: Yep - I developed a headache the first time I used the cold cap.  It needs to be tight unfortunately but you could ask to try on the next size up before it's switched on.  I did this at the chemo intro session and the next size up was really loose. It is well worth taking some painkillers beforehand.  I took co-codamol (left over after mastectomy) and ibuprofen, which helped a bit.  Also hot drinks and something distracting. Hope this helps Ann
Posts.Title: anyone who has experienced headache after trying cool cap?

Posts.Content: Hello pussycatgirl I had mastectomy and lymph node clearance 3 months ago.  It all went well although became a bit sore around the drains but they were only in for a week.  I was able to have a shower the morning after surgery and was home the same day. I've been using Bio-oil on my scar and also did regular exercises, which helped.  I had a soft insert initially and was given a front fastening bra.   Now got a silicone boob and a couple of nice post- surgery bras from M&S. Hope this helps Ann
Posts.Title: Having a mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Andrea I'm not sure how demanding your job is.  I had axillary clearance at the same time asy mastectomy back in June and K managed 3 days of work in July.  I have also done a few days during chemo.  But I do a fee-paid job so opted for short notice sessions when I thought I'd be ok (second and third week after each cycle of chemo).   Good luck with the advice from Macmillan and talking to work x Ann
Posts.Title: not the news I wanted today!!

Posts.Content: My post-biopy bruising lasted 6 weeks, was still there a bit when I went in for mastectomy.  The radiologist struggled to get a biopsy from the LN.  As far as I remember the bruising from the surgery was much less. Ann
Posts.Title: Bruised

Posts.Content: Second EC yesterday so tried a combination of 2 co-codamol 8/500 and 2 ibuprofen 200mg before the coldcap.  It was uncomfortable for the first 10mjns of so but fine after this.  I distracted myself with Samurai sudoku (although have gone wrong!) and husband got me hot drinks plus nice food from a cafe down the road.   I think my hair might be thinning a bit but asked the nurse about getting it cut short but she said it's fine.  I also checked about getting a flu jab and she said I should definitely get this. Ann
Posts.Title: New Cold Cap procedure (suggestions to help)

Posts.Content: I was thinking of trying a leave-in conditioner before the cap is put on this time (second cycle, chemo on 12th Sept).  My husband took me there and back by motorbike - I had a scarf over my icy hair but still dripped most of the way home!   I've got co-codamol from my surgery - would this be worth trying?  I think someone said paracetamol and ibuprofen worked for her. I wonder sometimes if it's worth carrying on with the coldcap as it was the worst thing last time Ann
Posts.Title: New Cold Cap procedure (suggestions to help)

Posts.Content: I've got dry eyes and don't get on that well with drops so I got Optrex spray.  Much easier, just spray onto eyelids.  But you might find drops to be more effective.  I have been told to lie down, rest the bottle on your nose and hopefully get the drops in the eye!
Posts.Title: awful dry sore eyes

Posts.Content: Hi I didn't have extra capsular extension in either of the 2 LN that were positive (had a level 3 clearance at the time of my mastectomy).  I assume that there may be a few cancer cells beyond that LN but the chemo and radiotherapy are there to get rid of any stray cancer cells.  I like to think of it as belt and braces treatment! Do you have a BCN?  If so may be worth speaking to her or if not the online nurse for expert advice.  Rupture isn't a great word - sounds dramatic. Good luck with the rest of your Radiotherapy and well done on getting through your chemo xx
Posts.Title: Extra capsular extension?

Posts.Content: Hi Gay Thanks for that,. I was thinking of trying paracetamol next time and I'll add in ibuprofen.  Second dose of EC next Tuesday so I'll let you know how I get on Ann
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hello - I started chemo last week, EC for 3 cycles and then the docetaxel.  The worst bit was the cold cap, I didn't expect it to be painful.  It did ease off a bit but my forehead was rushed for the rest of the day.  Other than that it was Ok. Anyone else with coldcap experiences?  I'm thinking of giving it another try next time.  Is it right that it doesn't work that well with docetaxel? Also the skin on my fingers is peeling but this may just be a late effect of a 5 day kayak trip x Ann
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi curlybird I think it's the anticipation of the unknown and I found it to be fine.  I haven't had a pneumonia jab and no-one has suggested it, so don't know about that. **Hugs** and good luck for next week x Ann
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi Lucasjack - I got lansoprazole in my bag of 'goodies' after my first cycle of EC and when I came out of hospital I was given a higher dose, which has been a godsend!  So you could get more from the hospital if/when you run out.  I've been taking it everyday since I started chemo x Ann
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Second cycle of EC was fine, apart from having to wait again (last appt in the morning).  But 2 days later started vomiting and then temp went up and ended up in A&E on Friday evening and stayed in until Sunday afternoon.  Nausea settled quite quickly once I was in and not neutropenic but I still feel wiped out and stomach is still unsettled. And I did think I was doing well! To top it all my hair started falling out.  It was thick to start with so hasn't gone completely but very thin.  So off to my hairdresser on Thursday with my new wig.  I'm not going to carry on with the cold cap, it's not worth it for me. Sorry about the moan but fed up and feeling rough Ann
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Hi kiwi_h I've got my 3rd chemo next week too.  I had bad vomiting after the second dose and also my liver function wasn't right so a lower dose this time. Saw the oncologist yesterday.  He recommended radiotherapy to start a month after finishing chemo so probably in January.   Similar post chemo treatment although I have the injections for 10 days and I've been able to do them myself Ann
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: My mastectomy and full lymph node clearance was at the end of June.  Most of the pain I had was from the drains.  My scar is a bit puckered in the middle and lumpy.  Armpit is numb and outside of my upper arm feels a bit odd, like the sensation coming back after a dead leg, but most of the time I don't notice it so doesn't bother me much. Ann
Posts.Title: Recovery after surgery

Posts.Content: Rings a bell for me too.  Found lump last Feb while walking the North Downs Way.  It was cold and very muddy, which didn't help but I've done several long distance walks previously and this was much harder. Slowly recovering but currently having radiotherapy and poorly controlled asthma since chest infections in April (also pre-diagnosis)
Posts.Title: Feeling old and tired before diagnosis.
